name: mrfilter
description:
Perform filtering operations on 3D / 4D MR images.

The available filters are: fft, gradient, median, smooth, normalise, zclean.

Each filter has its own unique set of optional parameters.

For 4D images, each 3D volume is processed independently.

References:
author: Robert E. Smith (robert.smith@florey.edu.au), David Raffelt (david.raffelt@florey.edu.au) and J-Donald Tournier (jdtournier@gmail.com)

inputs.name: input
inputs.description: the input image.

inputs.name: filter
inputs.description: the type of filter to be applied

inputs.name: output
inputs.description: the output image.

inputs.name: axes
inputs.description: the axes along which to apply the Fourier Transform. By default, the transform is applied along the three spatial axes. Provide as a comma-separate list of axis indices.

inputs.name: inverse
inputs.description: apply the inverse FFT

inputs.name: magnitude
inputs.description: output a magnitude image rather than a complex-valued image

inputs.name: centre_zero
inputs.description: re-arrange the FFT results so that the zero-frequency component appears in the centre of the image, rather than at the edges

inputs.name: stdev
inputs.description: the standard deviation of the Gaussian kernel used to smooth the input image (in mm). The image is smoothed to reduced large spurious gradients caused by noise. Use this option to override the default stdev of 1 voxel. This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all 3 axes, or as a comma-separated list of 3 values, one for each axis.

inputs.name: magnitude
inputs.description: output the gradient magnitude, rather than the default x,y,z components

inputs.name: scanner
inputs.description: define the gradient with respect to the scanner coordinate frame of reference.

inputs.name: extent
inputs.description: specify extent of median filtering neighbourhood in voxels. This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all 3 axes, or as a comma-separated list of 3 values, one for each axis (default: 3x3x3).

inputs.name: extent
inputs.description: specify extent of normalisation filtering neighbourhood in voxels. This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all 3 axes, or as a comma-separated list of 3 values, one for each axis (default: 3x3x3).

inputs.name: stdev
inputs.description: apply Gaussian smoothing with the specified standard deviation. The standard deviation is defined in mm (Default 1 voxel). This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all axes, or as a comma-separated list of the stdev for each axis.

inputs.name: fwhm
inputs.description: apply Gaussian smoothing with the specified full-width half maximum. The FWHM is defined in mm (Default 1 voxel * 2.3548). This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all axes, or as a comma-separated list of the FWHM for each axis.

inputs.name: extent
inputs.description: specify the extent (width) of kernel size in voxels. This can be specified either as a single value to be used for all axes, or as a comma-separated list of the extent for each axis. The default extent is 2 * ceil(2.5 * stdev / voxel_size) - 1.

inputs.name: zupper
inputs.description: define high intensity outliers: default: 2.5

inputs.name: zlower
inputs.description: define low intensity outliers: default: 2.5

inputs.name: bridge
inputs.description: number of voxels to gap to fill holes in mask: default: 4

inputs.name: maskin
inputs.description: initial mask that defines the maximum spatial extent and the region from which to smaple the intensity range.

inputs.name: maskout
inputs.description: Output a refined mask based on a spatially coherent region with normal intensity range.

inputs.name: strides
inputs.description: specify the strides of the output data in memory; either as a comma-separated list of (signed) integers, or as a template image from which the strides shall be extracted and used. The actual strides produced will depend on whether the output image format can support it.

inputs.name: info
inputs.description: display information messages.

inputs.name: quiet
inputs.description: do not display information messages or progress status; alternatively, this can be achieved by setting the MRTRIX_QUIET environment variable to a non-empty string.

inputs.name: debug
inputs.description: display debugging messages.

inputs.name: force
inputs.description: force overwrite of output files (caution: using the same file as input and output might cause unexpected behaviour).

inputs.name: nthreads
inputs.description: use this number of threads in multi-threaded applications (set to 0 to disable multi-threading).

inputs.name: config
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

type.name: config
type.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: key
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: value
inputs.description: temporarily set the value of an MRtrix config file entry.

inputs.name: help
inputs.description: display this information page and exit.

inputs.name: version
inputs.description: display version information and exit.

output-files.name: maskout
output-files.description: Output a refined mask based on a spatially coherent region with normal intensity range.
